body.name: Wizardom Legends: Temple of the Unknown: Action, Intrigue, & Humor in a Fast-Paced Fantasy Adventure (Tor the Dungeon Crawler Book 1)
body.description: D&D meets Indiana Jones in a new treasure hunting series set in the bestselling world of Wizardoms."Loved the characters. Great personalities, great action, and great quests." - ★★★★★A retired master ranger has disappeared, and his daughter is desperate to find him. When approached with this quest, Tor Ranseur declines...until he discovers this man went missing while following clues leading to a temple of legend.The magical artifacts rumored to await in these ruins are too alluring to deny.Joined by a dysfunctional crew armed with magical weapons, Tor sets off on a quest to locate, infiltrate, and pilfer the Temple of the Dark Lord. What he finds is something completely unexpected as monsters, traps, and betrayal turn the quest from dangerous to deadly.If you enjoy fast-paced questing stories, witty banter, and the discovery of magical artifacts, you'll love this all new series featuring the world's premier team of relic seekers.Be it your first Wizardoms novel or your 16th, you don't want to miss this all new, thrilling adventure!Click BUY IT NOW and join Tor's bantering crew on an action-packed quest. Read more

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #80,445 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #24 in Dungeons & Dragons Gaming #511 in Humorous Fantasy (Books) #900 in Action & Adventure Fantasy (Kindle Store)

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Meet the premier questing team across the Eight Wizardoms Tor Ranseur - Squad Leader Armed with enchanted weapons, this retired soldier leads his crew in search of magical artifacts that might tip the scales in the battle against the forces of darkness. His expertise on ancient history, skill in disarming traps, and ability to solve puzzles make him ideal for this role. Koji - Towering Warrior After more than a decade together as Murguard Soldiers, Koji is Tor's most trusted friend. While he stands seven feet tall and is as strong as an ox, he has a kind heart. Koji wears an enchanted gauntlet that replaced a hand lost in battle and wields a razor sharp hatchet. Borgli - Stone Shaper Exiled from his people, Borgli is a dwarf trapped in a human world. This fierce warrior wields an ancient, legendary hammer, and he possesses the innate ability to shape stone with his bare hands. Gruff at one moment, joking and brash the next, Borgli brings spirit and comical moments to his team. Quell - Ranger/Archer As the youngest and only female member, Quell rounds out the crew and provides a sense of balance. Raised by a master ranger, she is a skilled archer, tracker, and hunter, offering skills that the other team members lack. Her snark and sarcasm add humor and banter to the group dynamic.
Enthralling "An absolutely entrancing story filled with not only adventure and humor but also mystery, found family, and a whole lot of heart."
A Must Read "Another hugely entertaining and recommended read by Jeffrey Kohanek!"

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: A good read from the author of the series. Looking forward to reading more from the author of the series. Plenty of action and adventure and developing storyline between characters.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Relic hunter-adventurer search for the dark Lord's temple - finds crew, battles, fun along the way
reviews.reviewText: ARC reader. This book featuring adventures of notorious relic hunter Tor Ranseur has action, humor, battles, monsters, a bit of mystery and the start of bonds of friendship with a growing crew. Each character is unique and, while not yet fully developed as this is book 1, they are clearly typed. All of this makes it a fun read, especially the fun banter. The story is serious without taking itself too seriously. Jeff Kohanek is a great writer and delivers what he promises. I miss more of a deep emotional story experience, which is my preference in any book. The main character and the plot don't lend themselves to that, so it has the appropriate level just not as much as I enjoy. All the rest was great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love reading about Tor and his little gang. I loved the book and can not wait for the next. I liked how he picked up Quell and Borgli along the way. It was a great adventure, I would like to know who's temple they were in. I thought it mysterious how Vanda reacted to the one amulet and kept it all vague. It will be a great next book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A new adventure in the Wizardoms world!
reviews.reviewText: This is a new Wizardoms series with a crew of relic hunters... Tor and his crew are recruited to find a missing Ranger and any relics if possible. What they find is totally unexpected.... I enjoyed this book so much. The characters are captivating, the plot is solid and filled with magic, adventure, danger, battles with the darkspawn and many challenging situations. This is a gripping tale, cleverly written and a true page turner. Just the type of story I love. I was completely entertained and can't wait to read the next book to find out where Tor and his crew go next! "Warning", once you start reading this book you will not want to put it down!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Treasure hunting and more
reviews.reviewText: Tor is scheduled to be executed. Yet he is saved by Vanda. Personally not sure I would trust Vanda. Tor and crewmates, Koji and Borgli are soon joined by Quell and they are off to find a lost temple and save her father.I have enjoy all of Mr. Kohanek's works so far and this is no exception. He created a world like no other and just keeps expanding on it. I look forward to reading more of Tor and crew's adventures.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fun and serious
reviews.reviewText: Great story, neat group of adventurers. Sharp dialogue, good pacing and well written. It keeps me wanting to see where it is going. So much so, that I preordered part two, Castles of Legend. When it arrives, I will dedicate myself to it for a few days!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wizardom Legends : Temple of the Unknown
reviews.reviewText: Great characters ....... Interesting story ...... I really enjoyed the banter ....... Looking forward for book 2 in March .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars D&D meets Indiana Jones really does sum up this novel perfectly.
reviews.reviewText: Tor Ranseur's fame usually precedes him but call him what you like- relic hunter, dungeon crawler- he is always on the hunt to find long lost relics with his crew. When the daughter of a retired master ranger asks for his help to find her missing father, he wants nothing to do with the brash girl, until he learns that the man was looking for the long lost temple of the Dark Lord.Tor is the brains of the group armed with Claw he is an expert at traps, puzzles and ancient history. Koji is the muscle (though he is a softy at heart), Borgli the dwarf and stone shaper is the newest addition to the crew. But now Quell, the female ranger, joins to find her father and this unlikely crew struggles to get along. When death is just a step away, the crew must learn to get along and play to their own strengths while trusting each other.This was a fun, funny and fast paced story that had old school fantasy vibes without all the unnecessary exposition. Each character had their own quirks and I loved each one of them for what they brought to the story and how they balanced each other. It was really fun exploring the world with this crew and I just flew through this book.
A very interesting start to the trilogy. At times hilarious, but full of action and very interesting characters. The quests are very intricate and Indiana Jones like. I loved it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 15, 2024

reviews.reviewTitle: Average Fantasy Let Down by Pointless Perversions
reviews.reviewText: What should be an average 3 star fantasy suffers due to the authors decision to pointlessly add a trans/homo/whatever scene early in the story, a character that likes sheep far far far more than is natural, and regular references to ... male anatomy - its current status on a character, its absence from certain statues, threats of damage or amputation to it etc.Do we need to know this? No we absolutely don't, so it's unclear why the author focuses so much attention on such things.All that aside, the tale is decent and reminiscent of a D&D or similar adventure. There's also hints of things and a number of unexplained things, though it's unclear whether this is intentional or oversight. Is the benefactor human, or something more like ascended? Is, or was, the Dark Lord human? He's treated as an evil deity, but the human leaders of the assorted 'kingdoms' appear to be prayed to and worshipped as well Does this empower them somehow, or am I drawing false parallels and conclusions?
A great team assembles with lots of action and adventure. The characters are well drawn and likable And the story is good, as on would expect from Mr. Kohanek.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I recently dove into the world of "Wizardom Legends: Temple of the Unknown," and I can't stop raving about it! This book is an absolute gem for any fantasy lover.From the very first page, I was transported to a richly imagined world filled with action, intrigue, and humor. Tor, the Dungeon Crawler, is a protagonist you can't help but root for. His wit and resourcefulness had me chuckling, while his courage in the face of daunting challenges kept me on the edge of my seat.The plot is a rollercoaster ride of twists and turns that left me guessing at every corner. The temple's mysteries and secrets kept me hooked throughout, and I couldn't wait to uncover them all alongside Tor and his companions.What truly sets this book apart is its perfect balance of elements. There's no shortage of heart-pounding action, yet it's intertwined seamlessly with moments of humor that make the characters feel real and relatable. The world-building is impeccable, and I felt like I was exploring every nook and cranny of the temple right alongside the adventurers."Temple of the Unknown" is a delightful blend of everything you could want in a fantasy adventure. It's a page-turner that I couldn't put down, and I'm eagerly looking forward to the next installment in the Tor the Dungeon Crawler series. If you're a fan of fantasy, don't miss out on this thrilling journey into Wizardom Legends. Highly recommended!
